item.title: Bazaar
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@hotmail.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Overview ğŸ—ºï¸ ‘Bazaar’ is a web application developed using the Laravel framework as part of an academic project. It was collaboratively created by a team of two students. The platform is designed to integrate features reminiscent of â€œMarktplaatsâ€ and â€œiBoodâ€, offering a unique marketplace experience. The application supports three distinct user roles: private advertisers, business advertisers, and customers. Each role is equipped with specific permissions and functionalities, enabling interactions with various entities such as products or companies.

item.title: Temple of Doom
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@hotmail.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Overview ğŸ—ºï¸ ‘Temple of Doom’ is a console application developed using the .NET MVC framework. The goal of this assignment was to practice a lot of different design patterns. The front consisted of a console with different characters and colours, depending on the type of object and if it had a colour property assigned to it (in the case of a key or coloured door for example). Technologies Used ğŸ› ï¸ C# .

item.title: Pane Switcher
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@hotmail.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Overview ğŸ—ºï¸ ‘Pane Switcher’ is an application I crafted for a programming test at school. The challenge was to replicate a given example app within 90 minutes. This app featured a button that, when pressed, would modify the appearance of various panels. Although I completed the task within the exam period, I chose to refine my work at home for better results. Technologies Used ğŸ› ï¸ Java: The core language for crafting the application’s logic.

item.title: Reversi
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@hotmail.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Overview ğŸ—ºï¸ ‘Temple of Doom’ is a console application developed for a school assignment. The goal of making this application was to achieve a good understanding of OOP (Object Oriented Programming). I had to recreate the board game ‘Reversi’. The player(s) have to answer a few questions about the game configuration before starting. After that, it’s just a normal game of Reversi. Technologies Used ğŸ› ï¸ Java Eclipse OOP (Object Oriented Programming) Challenges and Solutions ğŸ§—ğŸ» Initially it was a little difficult to get a grasp on the concept of OOP (Object Oriented Programming).

item.title: About ğŸ‘‹
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@hotmail.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Hello! I’m Wouter Brunenberg, a software engineer with a passion for building scalable applications and exploring new technologies. Here’s a little more about my professional journey and interests. Background ğŸ” I’m a software engineering student at Avans Hogeschool, diving into the world of full-stack development. I’ve discovered a genuine interest in the logic and structure that comes with the realm of back-end work. While I’m still relatively early in my programming journey, I feel confident that I’ve already gained a significant amount of knowledge.
